title: Contributing
content:
(**
---
title: Contributing
category: Contributing
categoryindex: 99
index: 1
---
*)

(**
# Contributing to this project

This project was started to create a guide for new and/or inexperienced programmers using `F#`.

Our repository lives at: https://github.com/fsharpforyou/fsharpforyou.github.io

We use [`FSharp.Formatting`](https://fsprojects.github.io/FSharp.Formatting/) so we can write each page using literate `F#` scripts.

Prior art/inspirations/reference material:

 - [Learn You a Haskell for Great Good!](http://learnyouahaskell.com/)
 - [Clojure for the Brave and True](https://www.braveclojure.com/)
 - [OCaml Programming](https://cs3110.github.io/textbook/cover.html)
 - [The Rust Book](https://doc.rust-lang.org/stable/book/title-page.html)
 - And of course, the canonical [F# for Fun and Profit](https://fsharpforfunandprofit.com/)

*)

title: F# For You!
content:
(**
# F# For You!

Hang tight, we're still in the planning stages.

If you'd like to contribute, go [here.](https://github.com/fsharpforyou/fsharpforyou.github.io)

title: Installing F#
content:
(**
---
title: Installing F#
category: Introduction
categoryindex: 1
index: 1
---
*)

(**
# Installing F#
First, you have to install `.NET`. Follow the directions here: https://dotnet.microsoft.com/en-us/download

Once you've done that, you're done! You've installed `F#`! Wow!

For editors, we recommend `VS Code` with the `Ionide` extension.

You're more than welcome to use any editor that strikes your fancy. Except maybe not Microsoft Word.
*)


(**
## Our first program
There are a couple of ways we can run `F#` code.
To open an interactive session where we can enter code and have it immediately evaluated,
fire up your friendly local command prompt and type `dotnet fsi`.
Once you're jacked in, do the following:
*)

printfn "Hello world!";;

(**
Incredible. Do you feel the power coursing through your veins?

Type a few more things just to get your adrenaline flowing.

Make sure to include the `;;` at the end. This won't be required in
regular `F#` code, but is important to tell the interactive session
we're ready to be evaluated.
*)

let numbers = [ 0..99 ];;
(*** include-value: numbers ***)

List.sum numbers;;
(*** include-it ***)

(**
To exit the interpreter, type `#quit;;` and hit enter.
*)
